After coming up short in last season's state semifinals, Desert Vista is poised for another run with a team that has 10 NCAA Division I college commits. Richard Obert/azcentral sports 
Desert Vista's Tajiah Ellison swings during a practice on February 16, 2017 at Desert Vista High School in Phoenix, Ariz. (Photo: Patrick Breen/azcentral sports) 
2 CONNECT TWEET 1   Throughout the season, azcentral sports will highlight standout high school softball performances of the 2017 season.
Preseason All-Arizona Team Pitcher Nic Conway, Tucson Catalina Foothills, Jr.
Pitcher Lexy Coons, Tucson Sahuaro, Sr.
Pitcher Madison Seigworth, Chandler Hamilton, Jr.
RELATED: Acceleration of club softball fueling Arizona's top high school teams 
Catcher Shaye Bowden, Phoenix Sunnyslope, Sr.
Infield Wendy Castro, Oro Valley Canyon del Oro, Sr.
Infield Denae Chatman, Goodyear Millennium, Sr.
MORE: Arizona high school softball Super 10: Preseason 
Infield Alyna Torres, Glendale Cactus, So.
Infield Audrey LeClair, Phoenix Country Day, So.
Facebook Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Arizona's best high school softball programs   Fullscreen Post to Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 
Take a look back at the schools that have won titles in high school softball in Arizona since 1985, listed in order of championships.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 10 titles since 1985: Chandler Seton Catholic | Program has defined greatness at many levels. Jerry Mullin's teams won titles in 2010 and 2009 (4A-II), 2005, 2004, 2003, 2002 (3A), 1999, 1998, 1997 and 1996 (2A). School also won a title in 1983 and 1979. Team has won all of its title game appearances since finishing second in 1982.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 8 titles since 1985: Oro Valley Canyon del Oro | Won the 2012 Div. II title over Sunrise Mountain in 8 innings, 11-9. Won 2011 4A-I title over Vail Cienega in 5 innings, 11-1. Before that, won three straight Class 4A Division I state championships from 2007-2009 under coach Amy Swiderski. In 2005, school won 5A state title under coach Kelly Fowler. Dee Dinota led team to 2001 5A title. Kathy McQuown was the coach for 1992 title.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 8 titles since 1985: Joseph City | John Bryant led team to 2010 1A state title in 2010. School also won titles in 2009, 2008, 2005, 2003, 2002, 2001 and 2000. Six of the school's 8 titles came under coach Teddi Baird.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 7 titles since 1985: Tucson Sahuaro | Most recent title was in 2001 under coach Billy Lopez in 4A. That team went 32-2. Other 4A titles came in 1993, 1992 and 1989. Team won 5A title in 1991 and 5A/4A combined title in 1988. Other 5A title since 1985 came in 1985. Team also won 5A title in 1984.  Emmanuel Lozano/azcentral sports Fullscreen 7 titles since 1985: Winkelman Hayden | The school's last 2A state championship came in 2000 under coach Chito Guzman (pictured), who also led team to titles in 1992, 1991, 1989, 1988, 1987, 1986 and 1982. School also won title in 1976.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 6 titles since 1985: Mesa Red Mountain | Coach Rich Hamilton's teams won the 2014 and 2013 and 2012 Division I titles and the 2011 and 2010 Class 5A Division I titles. School's other 5A-I title came in 2006 under Rich Pikosz.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 6 titles since 1985: Glendale Cactus | Jeff Griffith coached Cactus to the 4A-I title in 2006 when his team finished 33-3 overall. He also led team to 4A titles in 2004, 2003, 1994, 1989, and 1987.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985: Phoenix Moon Valley | Most recent state title came in 1995 under coach Tom James in 5A. That team went 29-2. Team also won 1993 and 1992 5A titles under James. 1987 squad went 29-1 under Ginger Kurtz to win 5A title, while team also won title in 1986 with 25-2 record under Elaine Hunt. Other title came in 1981.  Emmanuel Lozano/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985:   | Jeff Oscarson led Firebirds to four straight 4A titles from 1995-1998, including a 33-0 season in 1996. Team also won 1989 title in 5A and finished 28-0-1.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985: Phoenix Northwest Christian | Most recent title came in 2007 under coach Jamie Bair in 2A state tourney. School also won 2A title in 2004. Team took home 1A titles in 1994, 1992 and 1989.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 4 titles since 1985: San Manuel | School won Division IV titles in 2014 and in 2013 under coach Deanne Brewer. 2014 squad beat Chandler Valley Christian, 5-4. 2013 team beat Phoenix Northwest Christian, 5-4. Went 24-2-1 in 1994 on way to 3A title under coach Jeff Rupright. Won 1990 title with 26-1 record. School also won titles in 1977, 1979, 1980, 1981 and 1982.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 4 titles since 1985: Peoria Sunrise Mountain | School won the 2013 Division II title under coach Jody Pruitt. Team also won back-to-back 5A-II titles in 2008-2009 under coach Nick Rizer. In 2006 it won the 5A-II title under Scott Miller. ... 4 titles since 1985: Snowflake | Most recent 3A title came in 2001 under coach John LaMarca. School also won titles in 1989, 1987 and 1986.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Kearny Ray | Teri Varley coached the school to 2A championships in 1995 and 1993. 1995 team went 26-3 overall. Rikki Galka guided team to Division V title in 2016. That team went 23-3 on the season.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Glendale Deer Valley | Most recent title came in 2011 in 5A-II with a thrilling 4-3 win over Tucson Ironwood Ridge. School also won the 2004 5A title under Carl Bakemeier. In 1998, team went 31-4 to win first title. ... 3 titles since 1985: Bagdad | Team won 1A title over St. David in 2011. Jay Smith led team to a 21-1 record and the 1A title in 1993. Team also won 1991 title.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Tucson Flowing Wells | Armando Quiroz led Flowing Wells to 5A state titles in 2002 and 2000 and to the 4A title in 1999. Team also won state title in 1984. ...3 titles since 1985: Winslow | School won Division III title in 2014 over Payson, 5-3. Also won 3A titles in 2010 under coach Becky Barris and in 1988 under coach Rick Cue.  Jill DiPasquale/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Phoenix Greenway | Ed McQuade's squad won the 4A-II title in 2008. Team also won titles in 1993 and 1992. Prior to 1985, it won titles in 1983 and 1982. Every title has come under McQuade.  Christine Keith/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Eloy Santa Cruz | This school is a perfect 5-for-5 in 3A state championships games. Andrea Reyes has guided the team to its most recent two, in 2008 and 2006. Team also won titles in 2000, 1980 and 1979.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Show Low | Coach Stan Bingham led school to 3A state title in 1998. He also led it to titles in 1995 and 1985.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Heber Mogollon | Most recent state title came in 1A in 2006 under coach David Whitmer. Whitmer also led school to title in 2004. Other title came under Ron Tenney in 1996.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Benson | Won the 2A title in 2011 over Tucson Pusch Ridge in 6 innings, 12-2. Went 35-1 on way to 2A title in 2008 with coach Shad Housley. School also won title in 2006 with 32-1-1 record.  Tom Tingle/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 state titles since 1985: Oro Valley Ironwood Ridge | School broke through for its first state title in Division II in 2014 under coach Rich Alday, defeating Oro Valley Canyon del Oro in the final, 2-1. Also won the Division II title in 2016.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Pueblo | Coach Lisa Pina led Tucson Pueblo to the 4A title in 1990. That team went 25-2. Curtiz Ruiz guided team to 2016 title in Division IV. It went 26-6 on the season and beat Camp Verde in the final, 5-0.  Danny Miller/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Vail Cienega | Team won the 4A-I title in 2010 under coach Eric Tatham. It went 28-4 on the season. School also won the 2015 Division II title over Tucson Salpointe Catholic, 9-2.  Xavier Gallegos/Tucson Citizen Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Superior | Andrew Smith's team won the 1A title in 2007, finishing with a 14-8 record. It also won the 2015 Div. IV state title over San Manuel, 3-0.  David Wallace/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Goodyear Estrella Foothills | School defeated Winlsow in the Division III 2013 state title game, 12-2. School also beat Winslow 7-5 in the 3A final in 2011.  Richard Hopkins Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Sahuarita | Won 4A-II title in 2011 over Peoria Liberty. Lone 3A title for the school came in 1999 under coach Chris Fanning. That team went 31-3-1.  Crystal Ochoa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Chandler Basha | The Bears won back-to-back 5A-I titles in 2008-2009 under Scott Hoffmeyer defeating   in 2008 and Mesa Red Mountain in 2009.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Salpointe | Won the 1996 5A title under coach Phil Gruensfelder while finishing the season 30-4. Went 30-2 in 1993 to win its first title under Stacy Hill. ... 2 titles since 1985: Western Christian | Won the 1A title in 1988 under coach Phil Adams. Also won title in 1986 under coach Al Hill. School took home its other title in 1982.  Charlie Leight/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Phoenix Arcadia | Won back-to-back state championships in 4A-II in 2006-2007 under coach Jason Foster.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Sabino | In 2005, Galen Paton's team went 33-1 on its way to the Class 4A state championship. Bill Belt led school to other title in 1991 when team went 23-3 overall.  Cori Takemoto Williams/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Prescott Valley Bradshaw Mountain | Won back to back 3A titles in 1996-1997 under Sharon Haese, going 29-2 in 1997 and 28-7 in 1996.  David Wallace/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Lake Havasu | Coach Bill Mullaly led team to back-to-back titles in 3A in 1992-1993. Team lost a combined 5 games in those two seasons. ... 2 titles since 1985: Thatcher | Won back-to-back 2A titles in 2003 and 2002 under coach Rachel Motes. 2003 team went 27-5-1, while 2002 team went 28-2.  Jennifer Ireland/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Florence | Larry Barrows led school to 2A title in 2001 with a 26-4 record. Team's other titles came in 1985 under Susan Niemi and in 1978 under Dan Turner. ... 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Desert Christian | Won back-to-back 1A titles in 1998-1999. First came under coach Bill Moten and second came under Gerald Dawson.  Yoko Furukawa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Chandler Hamilton | School took home the Division I title in 2016, its first state title in the sport. The team finished the season 31-6 and beat Phoenix Pinnacle in the title game, 3-0.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Catalina Foothills | Under coach Mark Stevens, school took home the trophy in Division III in 2016. It defeated Payson in the state title game, 8-0.  Danny Miller/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Sandra Day O'Connor | School won the Division I title in 2015, defeating Glendale Mountain Ridge in the state championship game, 2-0. The team finished the season 36-7.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Empire | School defeated Payson in the Division III state title game in 2015 for its first state championship, 6-3. It went 30-5 on the season.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Bourgade Catholic | School broke through for its first state title in the sport in 2012 with a 7-1 win over Winslow in the Division III title game.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Pusch Ridge Christian | School won its first state championship in the sport in 2012 with a 3-2 victory over St. Johns in 8 innings in the Division IV title game. ... 1 title since 1985: Eager Round Valley | Won the 3A title in 1991 under coach Willis Haws.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix St. Mary's | Bobby Pacheco's team won the 5A-I state title in 2007 and finished 29-8 overall.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Peoria Centennial | Bartt Underwood's squad broke through for its first title in 2010 in 5A-II.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Sunnyside | School's lone title came in 5A-II in 2007 under coach Pete Palomarez.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985:   | The Aztecs won the 2003 5A title under coach Jeep Ray, finishing 36-3 overall. School's other title came in 1982.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Mountain Pointe | The Pride, under coach Karen Jacobson, won their lone title in 1999 in 5A with a win over Tucson Salpointe. That team finished 30-6-1 overall.  Pat Shannahan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Horizon | School won the 1997 state title in 5A under coach Ken Goldwine, finishing with a 24-9-1 record.  Pat Shannahan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Mesa Dobson | Nancy Ellis led team to lone title in 1990 when Mustangs defeated Tucson High and ended with a 23-5 record.  Tom Tingle/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985:   | Shadow Mountain took home a title in 1991 with an 18-11 record under coach Gary Grant. School's other state title came in 1979.  Sherrie Buzby/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Yuma | Team won the Class 5A title in 1990 with a 25-5 record under coach Rick Kisselburg. School also won a title in 1977.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Mesa | Lone title came in lone title-game appearance, a 1-0 win over Phoenix Moon Valley in 1988 under coach Jim Richardson.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Desert View | Team won the state title in 4A in 2000 with a 2-1 win over Phoenix Moon Valley under coach Bert Otero. ... 1 title since 1985: Tucson Rincon | Rincon won the 4A title in 2002 under coach Russ Proctor, finishing 30-4-1. It was the team's lone appearance in the state title game.  Aaron J. Latham/Arizona Daily Star Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Thunderbird | Steve Ogborne's team won a 4A title in 1991 on its way to a 21-7-1 record.  David Wallace/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Glendale Independence | Lone title came in 1990 under coach Lee Pfeiffer in 4A.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tolleson | Lone title came in 1986 under coach Monty Anderson in 4A. That team went 22-4. Team also won title in 1978. ... 1 title since 1985: Tucson Palo Verde Christian | Tom Armour's squad won the 1A title in 1997 finishing with a 30-5 record.  azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Cottonwood Mingus | Tom Green led school to title in 1985 when it beat Douglas in the 4A final. Team also won title in 1981. ... 1 title since 1985: Salome | School's last title came in 1A in 1995 under coach Laurie Parker. That team went 23-2. School also won titles in 1977 and 1978.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Wickenburg | John Douthat led school to the 3A title in 2007 with a 1-0 win over Show Low. Douthat also led team to titles in 1979 and 1980. ... 1 title since 1985: Bowie/San Simon | Won 1A title in 1990 under Mike Peterson with 10-6 record.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Camp Verde | Lone title since 1985 came in 2A in 2009 under coach Debbi Miller. Team also won title in 1981. ... 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Country Day | Lone title came in 1A in 1987 under coach Paul Schweikher.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Willcox | School earned first title in 2010 in 2A under coach Mike Patterson. ... 1 title since 1985: Lakeside Blue Ridge | Chris Fraze led the team to its only title in 2009 with a 7-3 win over Winslow in the 3A final. It was the team's lone title-game appearance in its history.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Scottsdale Christian | Coach Mark Hickman led school to 2A title in 2005 with a 27-6-1 record. ... 1 title since 1985: St. Johns | Lone title came in 1994 under coach Shuryl Magargee. That team went 17-10 overall.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Queen Creek | Queen Creek won the 2A title in 1990 under coach Terry Thompson, defeating Florence in the final. It was the school's lone appearance in a title game. ... 1 title since 1985: Peoria | Wayne Hill's team captured a 4A title in 1988. School also won the title in 1983 under Mark DeGrow.... 1 title since 1985: Yuma Cibola | Title came in 1994 under coach Shelly Baumann in 5A tournament.  James Carreno/azcentral sports Fullscreen Like this topic? Outfield Tajiah Ellison, Phoenix Desert Vista, Sr.
RELATED: Last season's All-Arizona, softball team, all-state teams in each division 
Outfield Kelly Flynn, Phoenix Arcadia, Jr.
Utility Lainey Stephenson, Phoenix Veritas Prep, Sr.
Designated hitter Haley Busby, Phoenix Sandra Day O’Connor, Sr.
Suggest human interest stories to Richard Obert at richard.obert@arizonarepublic.com or 602-316-8827. Follow him at twitter.com/azc_obert . 
• Vote for your chance to win $1,000 for your high school in our Fan Experience contest 
• Nominate: All-Arizona teams, Athletes of the Week, Academic All-Stars 
• Cardinals' Larry Fitzgerald headlines the azcentral.com Sports Awards show 
Facebook Twitter Google+ LinkedIn All-Arizona softball team - 2016   Fullscreen Post to Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 
The 2016 All-Arizona team represents the best players regardless of division, while the All-State teams represent the best players in each division.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen Karlee Arnold | Chandler Hamilton, Jr. | Had take-charge attitude behind the plate, and hit .469 with 45 hits and 35 RBIs on Division I championship team.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Hayley Busby |Phoenix Sandra Day O’Connor, Jr. | Hit .528 with 67 hits, 43 runs scored, 26 doubles, 14 home runs and 70 RBIs on 29-win Division I team.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Denae Chatman | Goodyear Millennium, Jr. | She was her section’s POY, hitting .546 with 19 homers, 12 stolen bases, playing shortstop and pitcher.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Hailey Heeringa |Chandler Valley Christian, Sr. | Put up eye-popping numbers in Division IV, hitting .747 with 16 home runs and 81 RBIs and struck out only once in 109 plate appearances.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Lyndsay Steverson | Mesa Red Mountain, Sr. | Big run producer hit .495 with 14 home runs and 68 RBIs for Division I team.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Emily Ingles |Phoenix Arcadia, Sr. | Went 31-5 with a 0.87 ERA, 324 strikeouts and four no-hitters in Division II.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Shaylee Ackerman | Mesa Desert Ridge, Fr. | An outstanding pitcher (127 strikeouts), she was the leader at the plate for Division I team with .475 batting average, 13 home runs and 48 RBIs.  Courtney Pedroza/azcentral sports Fullscreen Nic Conway | Tucson Catalina Foothills, So. | Got on a roll in Division III tournament, striking out 61 and winning all five games en route to the school’s first state championship.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen C.C. Cook | Phoenix Pinnacle, Jr. | Won 19 games, helping the Pioneers reach the Division I final. Struck out 243 batters in 131.2 innings and had a 0.85 ERA.  Sean Logan/azcentral sports Fullscreen Rachel Hammons | Phoenix Bourgade Catholic, So. | She stole 50 bases in 30 games and hit .699 with a .731 on-base percentage for Division III team that won 22 games.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Alynah Torres | Glendale Cactus, Fr. | Hit .590 with 69 hits, 57 runs scored, 63 RBIs, 19 doubles, three triples and 14 home runs. Had a .933 fielding percentage at shortstop for Division II runner-up team.  Patrick Breen/azcentral sports Fullscreen Mara Kemmer | Phoenix Desert Vista, 5-8, 135, Sr. | UNLV-signee had a 1.09 ERA, 14-1 record, striking out 142 in 87.1 innings, and, playing center field when she didn’t pitch, she hit .551 and stole 16 bases, batting leadoff.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen Elizabeth Cartwright | Glendale Deer Valley, Jr.| She hit .531 with 52 hits, 19 doubles and three triples. She made only one error in center all season and had seven assisted putouts on throws to the plate.  Photo submitted Fullscreen Like this topic?
